course_title: Con Ed Elective: Special Topics in Systematic Theology: Eros Sexuality & Spirit
class_notes: (For students who entered the MDiv prior to Fall 2023 only; Concurrent enrollment in CE 552B or teaching parish or EASP Con Ed required; permission number required to enroll; request permission by emailing candlerregistrar@emory.edu beginning October 25) (Description: Sexuality is an important dimension of human experience, but it has been a controversial subject in churches. This course discusses the relationship between Eros, sexuality, and spirituality through theological writings, poetry, music, and art. It will explore the relationship between human desire and the love of God and the ways churches can approach sexuality in wholistic ways.)
schedule_location: M 2pm-5pm in Rita Anne Rollins Building_549
sections: Class Nbr: 5425, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 2-5p, Instructor: P. Kwok, Status: Open
